SEARCH
Package DepartmentObject

Class UserInfoDatabase

java.lang.Object
DepartmentObject.UserInfoDatabase
public class UserInfoDatabase extends Object
The UserInfoDatabase class manages the user's information for the Hospital Management System

An instance of this class works off of one database (one text file), allowing the Hospital Management System to include multiple UserInfoDatabase department if needed.

This class uses the BasePerson class and its derived classes to store information for each user in the hospital

See Also:
  • The Base class for all the users

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    UserInfoDatabase()
    Constructs a UserInfoDatabase that initialises an empty ArrayList of Patients, Doctors, Administrators and Pharmacists Also initialises a List of AppointmentList (Index = 0 refer to Pending, Index = 1 refer to Ongoing and Index = 2 refer to Completed) The AppointmentList for each is then initialised to be true (Dates are arranged in chronological order)

    • scheduleApt

      public void scheduleApt(Appointment apt)
      Schedules an appointment for a patient and assigns it to the appropriate doctor and patient appointment lists. This method handles appointments in three states: Pending (0), Ongoing (1), and Completed (2). The appointment is added to the pending list for both the doctor and patient involved in the appointment.
      Parameters:
      apt - The Appointment object to be scheduled. If apt is null, the method returns without action. If the doctor or patient specified in the appointment is not found in the database, a message is printed and the method exits. Otherwise, the following steps are taken:
      • The appointment is added to the global pending appointments list (index 0 in allAppointments).
      • The doctor's schedule is updated to include the specified date and timeslot for this appointment.
      • The appointment is added to both the doctor and patient’s pending appointment lists.

    • cancelApt

      public void cancelApt(Appointment toCancelApt)
      Cancels an appointment for both the patient and doctor associated with the appointment. The method searches for the appointment in the Pending and Ongoing lists, removing it from all necessary locations.

      The method performs the following operations:

      • Searches for the appointment in the global Pending (index 0) and Ongoing (index 1) appointment lists. If found, it is removed from the list.
      • If the appointment is not found in either Pending or Ongoing lists, a message is printed to indicate this.
      • Removes the appointment from the doctor's Pending and Ongoing lists, and updates the doctor's timeslot availability.
      • Removes the appointment from the patient's Pending and Ongoing lists.

      If either the doctor or patient associated with the appointment is not found, a message is printed indicating that the cancellation could not be completed.

      Parameters:
      toCancelApt - The Appointment object to be canceled. If toCancelApt is null, the method returns without action.

    • rescheduleApt

      public void rescheduleApt(Appointment newApt, Appointment oldApt)
      Reschedules an appointment by canceling the old appointment and scheduling a new one. The method first calls cancelApt to remove the old appointment and then calls scheduleApt to add the new appointment to the Pending list.

      If oldApt is successfully canceled, it is marked for garbage disposal, and newApt is scheduled as a pending appointment.

      Parameters:
      newApt - The new Appointment object to be scheduled in place of the old appointment.
      oldApt - The Appointment object to be canceled.

    • completeApt

      public void completeApt(Appointment completedApt)
      Marks an appointment as completed and updates the relevant lists for both the doctor and patient involved. The method moves the appointment from the Ongoing list to the Completed list.

      The method performs the following operations:

      • Sets the status of the appointment to Completed (status code 2).
      • Searches for the appointment in the global Ongoing list (index 1) and removes it.
      • If the appointment is not found in the Ongoing list, a message is printed indicating this, and the method exits.
      • Removes the appointment from the doctor's Ongoing list. If the doctor is not found, a message is printed.
      • Removes the appointment from the patient's Ongoing list. If the patient is not found, a message is printed.
      • Adds the appointment to the global Completed list (index 2), as well as the doctor’s and patient’s Completed lists.
      Parameters:
      completedApt - The Appointment object to be marked as completed.

    • docAcceptApt

      public void docAcceptApt(Appointment acceptApt, Boolean accept)
      Allows a doctor to accept or reject an appointment request from the Pending list. If the appointment is accepted, it is moved from the Pending list to the Ongoing list for both the doctor and patient. If rejected, the appointment is removed from Pending and marked for garbage disposal.

      The method performs the following steps:

      • Checks if the appointment is in the Pending list (index 0) and removes it.
      • If the appointment is accepted:
        • Sets the appointment status to Ongoing (status code 1).
        • Adds the appointment to the global Ongoing list (index 1), as well as the doctor’s and patient’s Ongoing lists.
        • Prints confirmation messages upon successful addition to the lists.
      • If the appointment is rejected:
        • The appointment is removed from the Pending lists of the doctor, patient, and global lists.
        • The appointment is set to null to mark it for garbage disposal.
      • If the appointment or doctor/patient is not found, appropriate messages are printed.
      Parameters:
      acceptApt - The Appointment object representing the appointment request.
      accept - A Boolean indicating whether the appointment is accepted (true) or rejected (false).

    • registerPatient

      public Patient registerPatient()
      Registers a new patient by collecting personal and medical information and adding the patient to the system's patient list.

      This method performs the following steps:

      • Prompts the user to enter the patient's full name, date of birth, gender, and blood type.
      • Initializes a new Contact object for the patient’s contact details.
      • Creates a new Patient object with the collected information.
      • Adds the newly created patient to the list of registered patients.
      Returns:
      The newly registered Patient object.

    • loadFile

      public void loadFile()
      Loads data from saved files into the system by reading from "HMS.txt" and "APT.txt".

      This method performs the following actions:

      • Attempts to open "HMS.txt" to load account data by calling loadAccount(Scanner file).
      • If "HMS.txt" cannot be read, it prints an error message and exits the method.
      • Attempts to open "APT.txt" to load appointment data by calling loadAppointment(Scanner file).
      • If "APT.txt" cannot be read, it prints an error message and exits the method.

      Both file reading operations close the Scanner after reading.
